articles.title: US immigration court blocks deportation of Tufts graduate student from Turkey, her attorneys say
articles.description:
Rümeysa Öztürk's attorneys said the immigration court found on Jan. 29 that the Department of Homeland Security hasn’t proved that Öztürk should be removed from the U.S.

The post US immigration court blocks deportation of Tufts graduate student from Turkey, her attorneys say appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: US immigration court blocked deportation of Tufts graduate student Rümeysa Öztürk on January 29.
Court ruled Department of Homeland Security failed to prove grounds for Öztürk's removal.
Decision allows Öztürk to continue her studies in Boston without fear of deportation.

articles.title: ‘I’d rather overpay and be comfortable.’ As mid-budget gyms die out, patrons face tough choices.
articles.description:
In Downtown Crossing, a budget gym membership at Planet Fitness will cost you $15 a month. For something a little more upscale, your nearest option is the Avery Street Equinox, where monthly dues are well over $200. At first glance, it’s a wide range of options. But the mid-budget choice, the New York Sports Club […]

The post ‘I’d rather overpay and be comfortable.’ As mid-budget gyms die out, patrons face tough choices. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Downtown Crossing's Planet Fitness offers $15 monthly memberships, but mid-budget gyms are disappearing.
Avery Street Equinox charges over $200 monthly, leaving few affordable options for Boston residents.
Patrons face tough choices between budget and luxury gyms, impacting fitness accessibility in the area.

articles.title: Making movies, like making sausages, is not pretty. Just ask John Sayles.
articles.description:
Ahead of several local appearances, the Oscar-nominated director of "Matewan," "Lone Star" and others talks about his new novel and the current state of cinema.

The post Making movies, like making sausages, is not pretty. Just ask John Sayles. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Oscar-nominated director John Sayles discusses cinema's challenges in local appearances this month.
Sayles, known for 'Matewan' and 'Lone Star,' is promoting his new novel.
Boston residents can gain insights into the film industry from Sayles' experiences.

articles.title: Mass. curler helps U.S. reach first Olympic curling mixed doubles final
articles.description:
Southborough's Korey Dropkin and his partner, Cory Thiesse, guaranteed the U.S. its first Olympic medal in the mixed event after a 9-8 victory over Italy in a semifinal match.

The post Mass. curler helps U.S. reach first Olympic curling mixed doubles final appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Southborough's Korey Dropkin and Cory Thiesse led U.S. to Olympic mixed doubles final.
U.S. secured a 9-8 victory over Italy in the semifinal match.
This marks the first Olympic medal opportunity for the U.S. in mixed curling.

articles.title: Boston College erases those Beanpot demons, knocks off Boston University to capture 21st title
articles.description:
In a hard-fought battle, the Eagles came out on top to secure their first Beanpot championship title since 2016.

The post Boston College erases those Beanpot demons, knocks off Boston University to capture 21st title appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston College wins the Beanpot championship, defeating Boston University in a close match.
This victory marks BC's first Beanpot title since 2016 and their 21st overall.
The win boosts local pride and enhances BC's hockey reputation in Boston.

articles.title: Home of the Week: Lakefront cottage with dock in Western Mass. for $700k
articles.description:
This two-bedroom house boasts views of Ashmere Lake in Berkshire County.

The post Home of the Week: Lakefront cottage with dock in Western Mass. for $700k appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Explore a two-bedroom lakefront cottage listed for $700k in Berkshire County.
Enjoy scenic views of Ashmere Lake with a private dock included.
Potential for increased tourism and property interest in Western Massachusetts.
